text: hi I'm Melissa Clark from the dining
section and I'm going to make Scheck's
yoga which is just fun to say as it is
to eat chuck chucka is a traditional
baked egg dish in the Middle East it's
made from a spicy tomato sauce with
peppers and onions and then you crack
the eggs on top and bake it my little
twist is that I'm adding feta cheese the
first step is to make the tomato sauce
I'm going to start by sauteing red
peppers and onion in a little bit of
olive oil and a nice pinch of salt you
want to get the vegetables really nice
and soft and the onion should be a
little bit golden so this is going to
take about 20 minutes now I'm going to
add garlic to the pan and saute it for a
couple of minutes and then I'm going to
add the spices and the spices your key
to the flavorings of this dish being
just right so I'm going to use cumin
paprika and a little bit of cayenne for
the exact recipe go to nytimes.com
slash dining almost forgot the black
pepper now I add some canned chopped
tomatoes and I'm going to let it simmer
for about 10 minutes till it gets a
little bit
once the tomato mixed up it's nice and
sick I'm just going to stir in the feta
and then crack the eggs directly on top
then put in as many eggs as you want I
think for this amount of tomato sauce a
proper ratio is six but if you love eggs
go ahead and use eight or ten then just
salt and pepper the tops of the eggs now
I'm going to bake this at 375 until the
eggs are done to taste about seven to
ten minutes I'm going to garnish this
with a little bit of cilantro right on
top so that's it
